definition: to press against/to support/to prop up/to resist/to equal/to balance/to make up for/to mortgage/to arrive at/to clap (one's hands) lightly (expressing delight) (Taiwan pr. [zhi3] for this sense)
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to provide (an asset) as security for a loan/to put up collateral
to resist/to boycott/to refuse (to cooperate)/to reject/resistance/refusal
to resist/to hold back/to stop/to ward off/to withstand
to repay a debt in kind or by labor
to compensate/to make good (a financial loss)
generally speaking/by and large/for the most part
to refuse to admit (what one has done)/to disavow/to renege
security (property held against a loan)/mortgaged property

sentences.english: He responded to the customers' needs by innovating.
sentences.chinese: 他以創新來應抵泯滅者的需求。

sentences.english: My father shouldered the door shut and carried the gift to our kitchen table.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸用肩抵上門，然後把禮物抱到廚房的桌上。

sentences.english: A little money now could go a long way.
The price barely covers the cost.
sentences.chinese: 這種價格剛夠抵上成本。

sentences.english: Only the most determined make the final journey up valley to the farthest extremity of the river.
sentences.chinese: 只有最虔誠的朝聖者纔會攀抵恆河末端最遠處的山谷。

sentences.english: The food stocks are limited, but also dug up to remove Chen Liang arrived in two years.
sentences.chinese: 而庫存糧食很有限，去掉陳糧最多還能挖抵兩年。

sentences.english: The limits of your language are the limits of your world.
sentences.chinese: 你的語言所及，即你的世界所抵。

sentences.english: CT284 has been displayed at I-Lan Sports Park.
sentences.chinese: 甫抵宜蘭縣立運動公園的CT284。

sentences.english: If it reaches the ground, it lands safely.
sentences.chinese: 如果牠抵逹地面，牠可以安全降落。

sentences.english: Pollen contacting the pollination drop was rapidly taken in.
sentences.chinese: 花粉抵珠心前，於授粉滴發芽與伸長。

sentences.english: Can tomorrow's death cast its shadow backward and darken today's joy?
sentences.chinese: 明天的死亡能充抵今天的快樂嗎？

sentences.english: Thousands cheered and waved as the pontiff entered in his popemobile.
sentences.chinese: 當教皇坐駕抵臨時，數以萬計的人振臂歡呼。

sentences.english: Shortly afterwards the wild bull with his horns gored him as if he were an enemy.
sentences.chinese: 不久以後，野牛用角來抵他，似乎他是他仇敵。

sentences.english: After the truffles delivered on the 16th, they will hold a "white truffle feast."
sentences.chinese: 松露16日送抵後，她們將舉辦一場“白松露盛宴”。

sentences.english: A good mother worth one hundred teachers, this sentence is not wrong at all.
sentences.chinese: 一位好的母親抵的上一百個教師，這話一點也沒錯。

sentences.english: The fruits mentioned in the preceding paragraph shall first be used to pay the expenses for collecting the fruits.
sentences.chinese: 前款規定的孳息應當先充抵收取孳息的費用。

definition: to compensate/to make good (a financial loss)
to exchange for (sth of equal value or utility)/to use in lieu/to redeem (a coupon etc)/to use to offset (an amount owed etc)
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
to return (an item)/to send back/to go back
to bring up to full strength/to make up a deficiency/to fill (a vacancy, gap etc)
to hand in/to hand over/to seize
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
document folded in accordion form/to fold
to lower/to decrease/to reduce/to subtract/to diminish
